record.text:
With therapy hard to get, people lean on AI for mental health. What are the risks?

Kristen Johansson's therapy ended with a single phone call. For five years, she'd trusted the same counselor — through her mother's death, a divorce and years of childhood trauma work. But when her therapist stopped…

external.description: Kristen Johansson's therapy ended with a single phone call. For five years, she'd trusted the same counselor — through her mother's death, a divorce and years of childhood trauma work. But when her therapist stopped taking insurance, Johansson's $30 copay ballooned to $275 a session overnight. Even when her therapist offered a reduced rate, Johansson couldn't afford it. The referrals she was given went nowhere. "I was devastated," she said. Six months later, the 32-year-old mom is still without a human therapist. But she hears from a therapeutic voice every day — via ChatGPT, an app developed by Open AI.
external.title: With therapy hard to get, people lean on AI for mental health. What are the risks?

record.text:
Seeking Signs of Life on Venus

Explore The planet Venus is a hellish world. Not only is this enigmatic, boiling globe holding tight to its secrets under thick clouds saturated with sulfuric acid, it harbors a biological question mark in those very clouds: Could Venus’s atmosphere be a haven for…

external.description: Explore The planet Venus is a hellish world. Not only is this enigmatic, boiling globe holding tight to its secrets under thick clouds saturated with sulfuric acid, it harbors a biological question mark in those very clouds: Could Venus’s atmosphere be a haven for high-altitude life? Venus is often called Earth’s sister planet, and it might also host a biota all its own. While the planet’s torrid surface seemingly rules out life, there is a possibility that microbes could live in the more temperate environment offered within the clouds of Venus, a hypothesis put forth by astronomer Carl Sagan in 1967.
external.title: Seeking Signs of Life on Venus

「利用者情報に関するワーキンググループ（第32回）」では、電気通信事業の個人情報取扱いについて継続的モニタリング枠組整備や確認項目、事業者評価が議論された。ターゲティング・非ログイン時の情報取得、オプトアウト時期、開示・第三者提供・同意、データポータビリティ等を確認し、Meta・LINE・ヤフー・Googleの評価で非ログイン収集や生成情報のポータビリティ未対応を指摘、2025年度も監視・報告を継続することを提言した。

A History of Government Shutdowns Traces Decades of Funding Struggles

The shutdown that is almost certain to start on Wednesday will be the 21st disruption of federal funding in the last 50 years, and the third to occur during a Trump presidency. How the federal government has been funded each…

external.description: The shutdown that is almost certain to start on Wednesday will be the 21st disruption of federal funding in the last 50 years, and the third to occur during a Trump presidency. external.description:
2025年9月29日、EXNOAはDMM GAMESの新CMを公開し、お笑いコンビ・マヂカルラブリーを起用した。  
CMでは、野田クリスタルさんがゲーム関連機器を身にまとった“ゲームの化身”として登場し、DMM GAMESの魅力を歌でアピールしている。  
野田さんはDMM GAMESの豊富なゲーム本数やスマホ・PC両対応の利便性を紹介し、初心者から本格派まで楽しめる点を強調した。  
村上さんは「運命の推しゲー」を見つける楽しさや、長く遊べるライフワークのようなゲームの魅力を語り、野田の衣装の面白さにも触れた。  
マヂカルラブリーは2007年結成の吉本興業所属コンビで、2020年には「M-1グランプリ」優勝、野田さんは「R-1グランプリ」で自作ゲームネタも評価されている。  
CMを通じて、DMM GAMESでの長時間プレイや新たなゲーム体験の楽しさを広くアピールする狙いがある。

record.text:
This is an insane decision. 

Excel has been *the* spreadsheet program for 40 years. One of the main reason a lot of people stick with Microsoft Office— there are better options for the rest of the suite but nothing is as good as Excel.

Shoehorning faulty AI into it is going to light that on fire.

Two things: 

Really basic editing prompts you to remove the qualifiers. It is weak writing that takes up more space--that used to matter for newspapers.

Reporters should spend a little more time imagining what historians looking at their writing will think of them.

"Dems will get blamed for a shutdown" as opposed to what, all the friendly coverage and positive credit they'd get for caving yet again? This whole premise is built on a delusion about what the alternative is. There's no cowering in the corner and being so inoffensive they won't still attack you.

Überhaupt nicht. Ich bin im Gegenteil mehr als desillusioniert, was die Fähigkeiten von Copilot angeht.

Meiner Meinung nach hilft das Tool ohnehin nur Leuten wirklich, die sowieso wissen, was sie tun. Den anderen liefert es nur die Illusion, etwas Brauchbares geschaffen zu haben. Das sehe ich nicht als enablement.

Microsoft is Bringing Windows Engineering Teams Back Together: Inside the Landmark Reorganization Fueling Big Time AI Innovation

Microsoft has announced a pivotal move to reshape the future of Windows: all core engineering teams responsible for developing its flagship operating system are now back…

external.description: Microsoft has announced a pivotal move to reshape the future of Windows: all core engineering teams responsible for developing its flagship operating system are now back together under a single, unified organization. The reorganization, led by Windows and Devices president Pavan Davuluri, aims to turbocharge Microsoft's AI ambitions for Windows and deliver on the vision of turning it into an "Agentic OS." As reported in an exclusive by The Verge, this major internal shift marks the most dramatic change in Windows engineering structure since 2018, when the company split its development efforts between the Azure and Windows teams.

record.text:
They very literally and directly help me make even more money, not to mention learn a lot and have fun.

But first come hours, sometimes days, of hesitatation and agony.

Once I overcome my hangups I never regret signing up, because the value I get from these tools is the deal of the century. They enable me to do amazing things at levels of creativity and productivity I could never have imagined before.
I currently subscribe to ChatGPT pro, Gemini pro, Raycast Avanced AI, Warp pro, Notion AI, GitHub copilot (sponsored), OpenHands (sponsored), Monologue. I use all of them, all the time.

You know how when you rub a lamp and get a genie and they fulfil your wish but there's always a hidden catch and you don't get what you ask for in some kind of tricksy way? That's what it's like trying to code with Copilot.

(Me at the station, Enigma-ly)

So Grok CLI (unofficial) was made by prompting Grok 4 to make a CLI for itself

Grok CLI can:
1. Modify local files and use the shell
2. Go through huge codebases and fix them
3. Persist for longer and solve really complex math and physics problems 

Pretty meta 🙂

Operai ha introducido controles parentales y una nueva página de recursos para padres en ChatGPT. Los padres pueden vincular cuentas con su adolescencia enviándoles una invitación. Las salvaguardas se encenderán automáticamente con…

external.description: Operai ha introducido controles parentales y una nueva página de recursos para padres en ChatGPT. Los padres pueden vincular cuentas con su adolescencia enviándoles una invitación. Las salvaguardas se encenderán automáticamente con características adicionales como horarios tranquilos, apagar el modo de voz y más. ChatGPT se ha convertido en uno de los chatbots de IA más utilizados a nivel mundial. Ser fácilmente accesible también tiene algunos inconvenientes. Muchos casos plantearon preguntas para la seguridad de los adolescentes. Incluso había un caso Donde los padres de un joven de 16 años que murieron por suicidio están demandando a Openai.
external.title: Controles de los padres ChatGpt: ¿Qué es y cómo usarlo?

external.description: Fortnite está haciendo todo lo posible para Halloween 2025, y la última fuga confirmada está volviendo las cabezas. El juego está llevando la película telefónica negra a Fortnitemares este octubre, y los jugadores tienen sentimientos bastante fuertes al respecto. La fuga proviene de fuentes confiables Fnbrintel, Shiinabr y Samleakss, por lo que probablemente esté sucediendo. Pero el personaje que están agregando es el Grabber, un secuestrador de la película de terror, y eso hace que algunos jugadores se cuestionen si Fortnite ha ido demasiado lejos con su contenido de temporada espeluznante.
external.title: Fortnite Black Phone Crossover recibe reacciones mixtas de los jugadores

Harder to digest. Make it less shiny. Make it less average.
To remind people how GOOD it feels to rub against something that’s not smoothed out. To stimulate their brains. 🧠 and what’s more important : their hearts.

Before AI became a thing. With our standardized instagram faces we hop into our silver/black/white cars, drinking a matcha latte, heading to our beige homes. 

👏🏻

I‘m so over this. 
Protest by making uncomfortable, eery, uncanny, crazy, unexpected out of the box art! Make it harder to understand,

10 (now over 20 XD) years of experience!

RIGHT?!

Well.
No. Either this bubble will burst soon, or the consumer base adapts to the uniformity, the averagification of everything. 
I‘m a tad bit afraid it’s the ladder, because somehow we managed to create the ultimate landscape of mediocrity even

record.text:
Maynooth experts develop way to recover prints from fired bullets

The method has to be tested and validated before it could potentially help law enforcement in criminal investigations. A new electrochemical test developed by Maynooth University claims to recover fingerprints from fired bullet…

external.description: The method has to be tested and validated before it could potentially help law enforcement in criminal investigations. A new electrochemical test developed by Maynooth University claims to recover fingerprints from fired bullet casings, something once thought nearly impossible. Biological traces such as fingerprints are generally destroyed once ammunition is shot, given the high temperatures, friction and gas that is released after a gun is fired.
external.title: Maynooth experts develop way to recover prints from fired bullets

Exclusive: Assort Health raises $76 million Series B to build on voice AI healthcare platform

Like so many people with busy 9-to-5s, high school teacher Suzanne Grinberg has a scheduling problem: By the time she has a free moment in her day to call her doctor to make an appointment, the doctor’s…

external.description: Like so many people with busy 9-to-5s, high school teacher Suzanne Grinberg has a scheduling problem: By the time she has a free moment in her day to call her doctor to make an appointment, the doctor’s office is already closed.  So, when she recently called her dermatologist before business hours, Grinberg expected to leave a voicemail—but instead got a pleasant surprise. “At 5:30 AM, when I was putting on my makeup to go to work, I was able to make my appointment,” she said. Grinberg’s dermatologist had started using a voice AI system called Assort Health, a startup building specialty-specific agents for healthcare.
external.title: Exclusive: Assort Health raises $76 million Series B to build on voice AI healthcare platform

record.text: Ég var svo „heppin“ að vera veikur í gær og hafa tíma í þetta og lét svo ChatGPT gera margra daga vinnu fyrir mig á klst. í morgun við almenna ánægju viðtakenda.

Það vill þannig til að við hjónin eigum far pantað, með Icelandair, til Kastrup eftir rúma viku og ég gat því gert samanburð í gær. Farið á sömu dögum með sömu vélum hafði hækkað um 75% en þegar ég skoðaði sömu vélar á sambærilegum dögum næstu mánuði að þá var 20% LÆKKUN m.v. það við borguðum.

Já, að mestu leyti. PLAY er bara með 12% og fullt af félögum sem til langframa gætu nýtt sér það gat. Annars tek ég ekki undir þá svakalegu dramatík að kalla ástandið í gær örvæntingu. Flestir farþegar sem talað var við voru pirraðir og höfðu allan rétt til þess.
Rien encore, je suis retombé dans Timberborn et j'ai Road 96 et Caravan Sandwitch achetés récemment. Pas sûr que je craque encore sur un jeu avant Noël (et pour Noël je me prends Winter Burrow)
Un part assez large de nos interactions avec Internet passent déjà par les plateformes des GAFAM, les chat bots LLM en sont la version ultime.
Je viens de lire "ChatGPT is on a path to become a real entry point to the internet", ce qui me semble malheureusement une estimation correcte et c'est vraiment pas une bonne nouvelle.

record.text:
Cloud CISO Perspectives: Boards should be ‘bilingual’ in AI, security to gain advantage

This edition of Cloud CISO Perspectives features Google Cloud COO Francis deSouza discussing the vital relationship between boards and CISOs. He emphasizes the need for boards and security teams to b…

#ai #news

external.description: This edition of Cloud CISO Perspectives features Google Cloud COO Francis deSouza discussing the vital relationship between boards and CISOs. He emphasizes the need for boards and security teams to become "bilingual" in AI and cybersecurity. This bilingualism allows boards to understand how AI needs security and how AI can bolster defenses. Evolving cybersecurity posture is crucial as AI expands the attack surface, requiring hardening of data infrastructure and access controls. Boards should integrate cybersecurity into business strategy, moving beyond compliance to protect critical assets. Developing a framework for cybersecurity investments ensures they deliver real business value and prepares organizations for breaches. Prioritizing cybersecurity in mergers and acquisitions is essential for due diligence and integration. Creating a cyber-aware culture from the top down, with regular board-level discussions, is paramount. Becoming AI and security savvy presents an opportunity for companies to enhance efficiency and security. Recent updates include information on securing shadow agents, combating bucket-squatting, and mitigating DNS risks with DNS Armor. Threat intelligence highlights the BRICKSTORM malware targeting tech and legal sectors and data theft from Salesloft Drift integrations. Podcasts cover the AI future of SOAPA, AI's impact on email security, and governing agentic AI.
external.title: Cloud CISO Perspectives: Boards should be ‘bilingual’ in AI, security to gain advantage

📣 New Podcast! "The DOPAMINE Menu: A 5-Minute BRAIN HACK to End Procrastination" on @Spreaker #adhd #adhdhacks #brainhack #dopamine #executivedysfunction #flowstate #focus #getorganized #habits #lifehacks #mentalhealth #mindfulness #motivation #neurodivergent #neurospicy #procrastination

external.description:
Do you ever stare at a simple task—like answering an email or doing the dishes—and feel a physical inability to start? It’s not laziness; it’s a dopamine deficit. Your brain is literally refusing to work for free.

But what if you could turn your to-do list into a game you actually want to play?

In today's episode, we're building the single most powerful tool for overcoming executive dysfunction: The Dopamine Menu. This isn't just another productivity trick; it's a personalized system for rewarding your brain and creating motivation on demand.

You'll learn:

- The simple science behind why your brain craves dopamine to get things done.
- A step-by-step guide to creating your own Dopamine Menu in under 5 minutes, using just your phone.
- How to categorize your "rewards" into 'Appetizers,' 'Main Courses,' and 'Desserts' to match the energy of your tasks.
- Practical ways to use your new menu to conquer laundry, paperwork, and any other "boring" task that’s been haunting you.


This one concept can fundamentally change your relationship with work and chores. Stop fighting your brain and start feeding it what it needs to succeed.
Let's build your menu.
external.title: The DOPAMINE Menu: A 5-Minute BRAIN HACK to End Procrastination

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "How to DEFEAT Workplace STRESS in 10 Seconds" on @Spreaker #angermanagement #calmunderpressure #careeradvice #careergrowth #conflictresolution #corporatelife #emotionalintelligence #emotionalregulation #emotionalresilience #leadershipskills #mentalhealthatwork #mindset

external.description:
Are you one passive-aggressive email away from a career-ending meltdown? You’re not alone. That feeling of hot rage bubbling up over a minor workplace irritation isn't a character flaw—it's your ancient brain running a fight-or-flight program in a modern office. And "just take a deep breath" is the worst advice you'll ever get.

Forget everything you think you know about anger management. This isn't about suppressing frustration; it's about transforming it into your greatest professional asset. In this episode, we unpack the psychology of workplace anger and give you a powerful, three-step framework for mastering your emotional intelligence that actually works under pressure.

We'll reveal how to become an observer of your own triggers, deploy the strategic "pause" to switch from your primal lizard brain to your rational prefrontal cortex, and reframe tense situations to gain strategic insight instead of losing your cool. This is the ultimate guide to emotional regulation for ambitious professionals. We'll also cover why setting boundaries at work and getting enough sleep are non-negotiable for building long-term emotional resilience.

Mastering this isn't just about stress management; it's about becoming the calm, influential leader in any room. It's time to stop being controlled by your emotions and start using them to fuel your career growth.

If this resonates with you, do yourself and your team a favor: hit subscribe and share this episode with a colleague who needs this today. Let's make composure the new superpower in the office.
external.title: How to DEFEAT Workplace STRESS in 10 Seconds

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "Is Elon Musk's NEURALINK the Next Step in EVOLUTION or a Body HORROR Nightmare?" on @Spreaker #ai #biohacking #bodyhorror #braincomputerinterface #brainjacking #cyberpunk #digitalconsciousness #elonmusk #ethics #existentialrisk #futureofhumanity #futuretech #neuralink

external.description:
Elon Musk wants to put a computer in your brain. Should you let him? He's selling a utopia of cured diseases and human-AI symbiosis. But what if the next step in evolution is a body horror nightmare waiting to happen?

Welcome to the definitive debate on Neuralink. This is not science fiction anymore. We're peeling back the layers of hype and "neuro-enchantment" to expose the terrifying ethical, social, and legal questions that big tech doesn't want to answer. We'll explore the activist world of biohacking, but then pivot to the urgent legal battle for "neurorights"—the fight to own your own thoughts in a world where they can be read, recorded, and maybe even rewritten.

We're diving deep into the darkest corners of Reddit and expert forums to discuss the real fears: "brainjacking," the monetization of your consciousness, and the terrifying possibility that your mind could become just another device to be hacked. This is a critical look at the neurotechnology that could redefine what it means to be human.

Are you ready to open Pandora's Box? This episode is your guide to the most important technological debate of our lifetime.

If this conversation just rewired your brain, subscribe and share this episode with anyone who needs to understand what's coming. Then, head to the comments and answer the big question: Would you get a Neuralink implant? Yes or no, and why?
external.title: Is Elon Musk's NEURALINK the Next Step in EVOLUTION or a Body HORROR Nightmare?

images.alt: THE TEMPTATION TO resign ourselves to resignation is never stronger than at a time of overlapping crises. The Al upheaval is unique in its ability to metabolize any number of dread-inducing transformations. The university is becoming more corporate, more politically oppressive, and all but hostile to the humanities? Yes—and every student gets their own personal chatbot. The second coming of the Trump Administration has exposed the civic sclerosis of the US body politic? Time to turn the Social Security Administration over to Grok. Climate apocalypse now feels less like a distant terror than a fact of life? In three years, roughly a tenth of US energy demand will come from data centers alone. 1) And in the middle of these concentric circles is the bedraggled individual, their intellectual autonomy —their humanity!- ever more under siege from the ingratiating question answerers in their phones.
